items.content_html:
The UIEvent() constructor page doesn't list resize under the type parameter, and the spec lists the same events as that docs page. I have also tested it in Chrome and Firefox and in both places resize appears as Event in the debugger.

I modeled these changes after the first generic Event example I found: DOMContentLoaded.
items.title: resize is an Event, not a UIEvent

items.content_html:
Starting a new test, Getting the document you want to test, Interacting with the document and Testing your element.

Description

The code in the Starting a new test, Getting the document you want to test, Interacting with the document and Testing your element sections were updated so that users can accomplish what is mentioned in them. The previous code was not producing the desired results. Popup interaction and the ability to add text into one of the form elements mentioned in the Testing your element section was not producing the desired results.

Motivation

To allow readers to understand how to accomplish what is mentioned in the Starting a new test, Getting the document you want to test, Interacting with the document and Testing your element sections.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: updated the code in the four sections mentioned below:

items.content_html:
This pull request fixes #29910

It changes the summary in 'font-variant-caps' page from 'capital letters' to the text matching what is explicitly written in w3 docs of font-variant-caps.

To propose the better wording, I used the exact same text as is already used in linked docs, to keep the pages consistent.
items.title: Replace capital letters with small or petite capitals in font-variant-caps

items.content_html:
Description

This MDN document does not:

  • disambiguate between ARIA versions,
  • cover ARIA changes across versions,
  • address the fact that ARIA itself is silent on "ARIA annotations",
  • nor does it mention the unmaintained ARIA Annotations draft specification.

Motivation

This page has been causing confusion for months, causing some recent internal client documentation to assert this is a "feature of ARIA 1.3", and citing only this page as evidence.
items.title: Clarify ARIA versions, the other spec

items.content_html:
Description

For precise scientific measurements, terms Nominal sea level is used not sea level.

Motivation

The GeolocationCoordinates.altitude, property is representing the altitude of the position in meters above the [WGS84] ellipsoid. WGS84 ellipsoid are often used as a reference for nominal sea level.

Nominal sea level is theoretical and average level of the sea surface over a specified period and on the other hand sea level is measure of the height of the ocean's surface above a reference point on land, it can be measured every day.

Additional details

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/GeolocationCoordinates/altitude

Related issues and pull requests

PR:
#30490
items.title: Typo:- correcting to Nominal sea level

items.content_html:
Please refer to the IEEE Standard 754 for floating-point encoding.

Description

The example on the page is incorrect for both systems (little and big endian).
A number in JS is encoded to become:
SEEEEEEEEEEEMMMMMMMMM...MMM
S : sign bit
E : 11 exponent bits
M : 52 Mantissa bits

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Correcting a code example

### Border images

#### Specifying the border image
#### Slicing the border image
#### Adjusting the width of the border image

This PR also edits a few existing subsection headings for consistency.

Motivation

Related issues and pull requests

items.title: docs(learn): Add border image information to Learn area

items.content_html:
This PR fixes the examples for the ::webkit-meter-* selectors by performing the following:

  • Programmatically check for Safari with JavaScript to set -webkit-appearance: none
    • Setting -webkit-appearance: none breaks rendering in Chrome, so it has to be programmatically set now (Chrome used to not support the -webkit- prefix)
  • Update the fallback texts of the meters to better represent what the value of the meter is
  • For comparison purposes, make two versions of the meters: one normal and one styled
    • Doing so helps show what is actually changed in styling
  • Fix the attributes of the <meter> elements to reflect what the example is actually supposed to demonstrate

Additionally, this fixes some of the summary text for accuracy.
items.title: Fix examples for ::-webkit-meter-* selectors

items.content_html:
This updates CustomStateSet and Using custom components to reflect the addition of support for exposing states from a custom web component so that they can be used as a selector for CSS.

Note, it also moves CustomStateSet and ElementInternals into the Web Components sidebar rather than DOM sidebar - of course all of these are also DOM, but they can only be used in custom components.

Things to do.

  • CustomStateSet
    • needs to show how to attachInternals - you can't use this otherwise.
    • Text incorrectly refers to it as CustomStateList
    • Structure needs to follow current templates
    • Example is cut down version of the spec checked state checkbox thingy. Better to either show whole thing or a different example.
    • Omits how you handle multiple non-boolean states. Perhaps a loading, non, loading state like spec but worked.
    • I think these can only be done with automatic components, not built ins. Confirming.
  • Using custom components - cross link and at least outline what you can do.

Related docs work in #30339
items.title: CustomStateSet plus using custom elements
